column4: Hey all - I just installed 12.04 x64 - I know its in /dev/sda2 - I cannot boot into the new OS now. I get the Fix Error "operating System Not Found" from Intel Boot Agent..
How do I make grub point to boot from /dev/sda2?
Ther eis only one partition - this is a 500GB hdd. Installed 12.04 from the live CD
The only thing I could think of is to check to make sure the partition is marked bootable.
OK, it has fdisk which is what I've used before. you run 'fdisk /dev/sda' and then 'l'
L3top, there is no * under BOOT column from fdisk o/p, denoting that the partition is not bootable?
Yes, if you type 'a' and then the partition number, you can type 'p' again and it should show it's bootable.
You need to type 'w' to save though, or else nothing will happen
ok we will try and report back
I've sent the o/p of the WRITE - which spat out an error. Hoep that is fine?
It might be, but if it wasn't marked bootable that's definitely a problem.
okay. Now it's marked as bootable
